title: AuroraCalc
text: AuroraCalc is a symbolic math library for polynomials. It supports exporting expressions to LaTeX. For large degrees, AuroraCalc switches to FFT-based multiplication.

title: AuroraCalc
text: AuroraCalc exposes a Python API called `aurora.poly` for polynomial ops. It can factor polynomials over the integers and rationals.

title: AuroraCalc
text: Users on forums discussed AuroraCalc tutorials and workshop schedules.

title: AuroraCalc
text: AuroraCalc community survey results will be published next quarter.

title: NebulaDB
text: It supports JSON documents with automatic schema inference. Defaults are sensible for most users.

title: NebulaDB
text: The default port for NebulaDB is 7342. NebulaDB uses a CRDT-based replication protocol for offline-first apps.

title: NebulaDB
text: NebulaDB is a lightweight document store built for edge devices.

title: NebulaDB
text: NebulaDB provides role-based access control with three roles: reader, writer, admin.

title: NebulaDB
text: Users on forums discussed NebulaDB tutorials and workshop schedules.

title: AtlasNLP
text: AtlasNLP is a multilingual text processing suite.

title: AtlasNLP
text: Models are packaged in ONNX format for portability. AtlasNLP has a rule-based fallback for rare tokens. Dictionaries are configured in `atlas.yml`.

title: Atlas NLP
text: It provides sentence splitting, NER, and lemmatization for 50+ languages.

title: LyraVision
text: LyraVision can export detections in COCO JSON format.

title: LyraVision
text: LyraVision is a tiny vision model package for edge cameras. The pipeline includes frame differencing to reduce false positives.

title: LyraVision
text: It provides on-device object detection for five classes by default. It integrates with CI/CD tools.

title: LyraVision
text: LyraVision models are quantized to INT8 for performance.

title: LyraVision
text: LyraVision release notes mention minor UI tweaks and logging improvements.
